description:
build: re-enable some broken tests in run.bash
        Part of issue 2982.
        The remaining ones are blocked by issue 3118 and 3009.

messages.text:
PTAL.
On 2012/02/28 20:40:42, rsc wrote:
> Please wait until this can be done without make.
> Not all systems even have a working make.
OK. I removed the changes on misc/goplay/Makefile (strictly speaking is not relevant
to this CL).

The remaining three enabled tests in this CL won't use make, only bash scripts and
plain cmd/go. (We are already using bash to run run.bash, so I guess using bash to
test shoutout is acceptable)

Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com (cc: golang-dev@googlegroups.com),

I'd like you to review this change to
https://code.google.com/p/go/

Please wait until this can be done without make.
Not all systems even have a working make.

Please wait.

This will get easier with some pending go command changes.

Thanks, but I'd like to redo these to use the go command,
not make, and the go command is not ready yet (but I'm
working on it right now).

Russ

PTAL.

On 2012/02/28 20:32:01, rsc wrote:
> Thanks, but I'd like to redo these to use the go command,
> not make, and the go command is not ready yet (but I'm
> working on it right now).
Except for doc/progs and doc/articles/wiki, all other enabled tests can be done
without new cmd/go feature, or make (I guess bash scripts are usable).

subject: code review 5702052: build: re-enable some broken tests in run.bash
